text: <@U013ZLJARC7> Thanks - I had seen that before, but forgot about PostmarketOS. That might be a good candidate to run on the PineNote - <https://wiki.postmarketos.org/wiki/PINE64_PineNote_(pine64-pinenote)>. I'm taking Alan Kay's idea to heart of starting with a minimal Smalltalk system (basically just the object model and some core classes), and rebuilding everything else. For example, I think this is a good model for handling user interactions - <https://twitter.com/sumim/status/1483484229543800833>, Just need to think through whether I'll need coroutine support to make it more natural.

<https://twitter.com/sumim|@sumim>: <https://twitter.com/dubroy|@dubroy> <https://twitter.com/yoshikiohshima|@yoshikiohshima> Please also play with my implementation of your "Drag and Drop example" in Squeak Smalltalk's classic MVC!

<https://squeak.js.org/run/#url=http://squab.no-ip.com/squeakjs/uploads&zip=[DnDExSq22MVC.zip,SqueakV2.sources.zip]&swapButtons=true> <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FJZjQk8aUAIWvHP.png>

elements.text: Thanks - I had seen that before, but forgot about PostmarketOS. That might be a good candidate to run on the PineNote -

. I'm taking Alan Kay's idea to heart of starting with a minimal Smalltalk system (basically just the object model and some core classes), and rebuilding everything else. For example, I think this is a good model for handling user interactions -
, Just need to think through whether I'll need coroutine support to make it more natural.
